jirleech wrote:

>
> I have the settings for timeout on a crawl to 2 minutes.  I notice
> this usually always works correctly.  It seems as though sometimes a
> crawl will last over the timelimit by an large amount, up to hours.  I
> was wondering does setting the timelimit cause an abrupt stop or does
> it wait until things that it may be currently downloading to finish. 
> For example if it hit the timeout but was downloading a large ISO
> would it try to finish it before ending?  Thanks,
> ~chris
>
Each thread goes to the frontier to ask it for the next URI to crawl.  
Inside in the Frontier#next is the check if the max-time-to-crawl value 
has been exceeded.

This means that if a thread is currently struggling w/ a download, it 
will only notice that max-time-to-crawl has been exceeded after the 
current awkward download has completed when it goes to ask the frontier 
whats next. 

There is no abrupt abort of downloads.

"Up to hours" seems odd though.  Can you watch the frontier report to 
see threads quieting down?  Can you attribute the 'hours' to a 
particular download -- perhaps doing a parallel fetch of the problematic 
URL to confirm its taking hours to download?

St.Ack

>
